Read More
item.content:encoded:
Snack recipe: Palak pakoda

Perfect evening snack can make on different occasions, easy to make with simple ingredients. They’re crispy outside and tender inside, anybody can prepare these fritters.

Let’s start with ingredients and follows the procedure

Servings: 5

Duration: 20 minutes

Ingredients:

  • Spinach – Bunch – chopped
  • Besan or chickpea flour ‚Äì 1 cup ‚Äì 240 grams
  • Rice flour ‚Äì 2 tbsp
  • Carom seeds or ajwain seeds ‚Äì 1/2 tsp
  • Red chilly powder ‚Äì 1/2 teaspoon
  • Cumin seeds – 1/2 tsp
  • Salt ‚Äì 1/2 teaspoon
  • Baking soda ‚Äì 1/ 4 teaspoon
  • Turmeric powder ‚Äì 1/4 teaspoon
  • Water ‚Äì 60 ml
  • Oil ‚Äì to deep fry

Procedure:

  • In a deep bowl, add besan, rice flour, red chilly powder, turmeric powder, salt, baking soda, ajwain seeds, cumin seeds, spinach and mix well
  • Then add water, mix well and it should be semi-thick consistency
  • Heat oil to deep fry, take small portions of pakoda batter and gently drop in oil, each at a time.
  • Fry till the pakoda’s become golden brown as shown in the video
  • Repeat the process till the batter completes, enjoy your day and happy cooking

Detailed recipe on youtube, Check out below video:

You might also like these recipes:

  • Jeera rice
  • Aloo methi pulao
  • Poori
  • Palak Paratha
  • Lachha Paratha with wheat flour

There are different types in the making process of majjiga pulusu which varies from region to region. Majjiga means “buttermilk” which is whisked...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
Side dish: Bendakaya Majjiga Pulusu

Servings: 3

Duration: 40 minutes

One of the best yogurt recipes in south Indian cuisine is Majjiga pulusu, it’s an authentic and popular dish in Andhra meals. There are different types in the making process of majjiga pulusu which varies from region to region. Majjiga means “buttermilk” which is whisked curd or yogurt with water, The semi-thick consistency gravy prepared by using few peculiar ingredients used in our daily lives, these ingredients make the gravy thicken, smooth and shiny You can include any vegetable mix to make it but I simply used okra and bottle gourd which turned out delicious and finally garnished with coriander leaves. I love curd recipes if you do so try this homemade tasty side dish paired up with Hot rice or chapathi.

In my past recipes, I have shared sorakaya majjiga pulusu you can either click this link or you can find in search tab, also I am sharing few other curries recipes at the end of this post! please do check

Let’s start with ingredients and procedure

Ingredients:

  • Okra / Bendakaya – 5 – cut head & tail and chop 1-inch pieces
  • Sorakaya / Bottle gourd – 1 cup – chopped – big chunks
  • Onion – 1/2 cup – chopped
  • Mustard seeds – 1/2 tsp
  • Cumin seeds – 1 tsp
  • Hing/ asafoetida – 1/4 tsp
  • Whisked curd – 1/2 cup – 120 ml
  • Salt – 2 teaspoons
  • Turmeric powder – 1/2 tsp
  • Coconut oil – 1 tbsp
  • Coriander leaves – 1/4 cup – chopped

Masala paste:

  • Raw rice – 1/2 tbsp – soaked 20 mins in water
  • Red gram or kandi pappu – 1/2 tbsp – soaked 20 mins in water
  • Green chilies – 5
  • Curry leaves – 5
  • Coconut – fresh or frozen – 1/4 cup
  • Cumin seeds – 1 tsp

Procedure:

  • First, grind all masala paste by adding 1/4 cup water in it. make a smooth paste and keep aside
  • Heat a heavy-bottomed pan add oil, add cumin and mustard seeds.
  • Let them splutter then goes in onion. Saute 2 mins
  • Next add chopped okra, bottle gourd and saute 5 minutes then add salt, turmeric powder, saute.
  • Next add the grounded masala paste Combine well and let it cook more 5 minutes then add water, mix well and cover with the lid.
  • Let it cook 5 minutes and then add whisked curd, combine well and cover with the lid and cook more 10 minutes.
  • When the gravy starts thickening add coriander leaves, stir and turn off the heat
  • Serve with piping hot rice or phulka. Happy Cooking and have a nice day

Step by step process shown below with pictures:

  • Aloo Mutter Curry| Potato Peas Curry |Side Dish
  • Dal Makhani | Restaurant style | Side Dish
  • Vankaya Bajji Kura |Brinjal and Tomato Curry | Side Dish

I know 90% of the population loves potatoes üòâ so you will definitely like this...

item.content:encoded:
Snack recipe: Potato Bajji

Servings: 4

Duration: 20 minutes

Have you been ever tried potato bajji or potato fritters at home If not, try these scrumptious evening snacks or you can pair it with sambar, rasam or pulihora rice. I know 90% of the population loves potatoes so you will definitely like this potato bajji as well. When the season changes at this time weather call you to make these fried snacks, this recipe is super simple to make. So, why are you waiting for, go grab a potato and prepare bajji’s at home and get compliments from family! I have shared a few links down, I hope you will try and like those recipes.

Let’s start with Ingredients and follows the procedure

Ingredients:

  • Potato ( Gold or Red ) – 1 – sliced round
  • Besan or chickpea flour – 1 cup – 240 grams
  • Rice flour – 2 tbsp
  • Carom seeds or ajwain seeds – 1/2 tsp
  • Red chilly powder – 1 teaspoon
  • Salt – 1/2 teaspoon
  • Baking soda – 1/ 8 teaspoon
  • Turmeric powder – 1/4 teaspoon
  • Water – as required to make the batter
  • Oil – to deep fry

Procedure:

  • In a deep bowl, add besan, rice flour, red chilly powder, turmeric powder, salt, baking soda, ajwain seeds and mix well
  • Then add water as required to make the batter, it should be semi-thick consistency
  • Heat oil to deep fry, dip chopped potato slices in besan batter and gently drop in oil, each at a time.
  • Fry till the bajji’s become golden brown as shown in the picture
  • Repeat the process till the potato slices complete, enjoy your day and happy cooking
  • Serve with tomato ketchup or topped with chaat masala powder

Step by step process shown below with pictures:

You might also like these recipes:

  • Pani puri
  • Crispy Hash Browns
  • Crispy Idly Fries
  • Garlic roasted baby potatoes with basil | Snack
  • Roasted Garlic Bhel Mix | Spicy Puffed rice Mix | Chatpata Snack

Recipe link shared below, please do check üòÉ Another name for Lotus seeds called as fox nuts can Puffed up like pop corn üçø easy to munch...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
Snack recipe: Chatpata Phool Makhana

Servings: 3

Duration: 5 minutes

Phool Makhana snack can make many varieties, so I‚Äôm sharing Chatpata Phool Makhana with homemade Frankie Masala Powder. Recipe link shared below, please do check

Another name for Lotus seeds called as fox nuts can Puffed up like pop corn easy to munch on anytime, they are delicious, crispy and melts nicely. They‚Äôre so many varieties of recipes by using Phool Makhana or popped lotus seeds are available at any Indian store, easy to grab a pack and make this yummy healthy snack at home in 5 minutes.

Phool Makhana used to have during the fasting, it can be prepared as kheer, curry or snack. In this recipe, I used pink Himalayan salt if it‚Äôs not available to you, you can skip it and use regular salt.

Health Benefits of Phool Makhana:

  • Anti-aging
  • 9.7g of protein in 100 gms
  • Low in calories, fat, and sodium.
  • High potassium and magnesium content makes them very useful for people with high blood pressure
  • High calcium content is good for bone and teeth health
  • Sugar content is low so useful for diabetics
  • Useful for kidney ailments
  • People looking for weight loss should try makhana, as they are very low in calories but can fill the stomach.
  • It is rich in fiber and so can be used in weight loss as well as for digestion problems like constipation

Let‚Äôs start with Ingredients and follows Procedure

Ingredients:

  • Phool Makhana – 100 grams ( store bought)
  • Butter – 1/2 Tb sp
  • Cashew Nuts – 20 – chopped
  • Himalyan salt – 1/4 teaspoon
  • Frankie Masala Powder ( click for recipe) – 1 teaspoon

Procedure:

  • Put a deep frying pan On medium heat
  • Add butter, let it melt then add chopped cashew nuts
  • Fry for one minute then add Phool Makhana, Combine well and add salt and Frankie Masala Powder
  • Mix well and stir continuously
  • Saute till the Makhana becomes crispy , it takes more 2-3 minutes and turn off heat
  • Leave the pan on stove for more crunchy Phool Makhana ( half minute or so. It‚Äôs optional)
  • As I have used cashew nuts, you can use peanuts as well
  • Serve immediately or you can store in an airtight container to remain fresh
  • Happy Cooking and Have a blissful day

Checkout other snack recipes:

  • Vankaya Bajji (2 ways) | Brinjal Fries |
  • Masala Puri || Street Food || South India
  • Bread Cutlets / Patties
  • Cauliflower Manchurian Gravy/Gobi Manchurian Gravy
  • Phool Makhana | Version 1

Biryani is famous in India with gives amazing taste, infused in aromatic Indian spices, combination of vegetables, whole Biryani...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
Lunch Recipe : Paneer Biryani

Servings: 4

In India, On special occasions or at parties or on wedding day Biryani must include in the food list because it is a traditional dish following from many years. Biryani is famous in India with gives amazing taste, infused in aromatic Indian spices, combination of vegetables, whole Biryani spices & totally it‚Äôs flavourful with Basmati Rice ( long grain )

Today, I‚Äôm sharing a super delicious, perfect for quick lunch box recipe ideas and instant one-pot cooking rice recipe is Paneer Biryani.

Nutritional values of paneer:

 

Paneer: 40gms
Protein 7.54gm
Fat 5.88gm
Carbs 4.96gm
Energy 103.15Kcal
Folates 37.32microgram
Calcium 190.4mg

Paneer called as Indian Cottage Cheese which is extract from milk has lots of good healthy benefits in it. It has all essential nine amino acids, nourishing and healthy when taken in right amounts. Earlier, I have shared few recipes of paneer in my food blog, links shared below you can checkout

  • Paneer Paratha
  • Palak Paneer Gravy
  • Paneer Tikka | Baked | Starter
  • Hariyali Paneer |Cottage Cheese Green Curry

Duration: 40 minutes

Ingredients:

  • Basmati Rice – 1 cup – 160 grams – wash thrice and keep aside
  • Paneer – cubes – 100 grams
  • Cloves – 2
  • Cinnamon stick – 1 inch
  • Cardamom – 2
  • Star Anise – 1
  • Shajeera – 1 teaspoon
  • Bay leaf – 1
  • Ginger Garlic Paste – 1 teaspoon
  • White onion – 1/2 cup – chopped
  • Carrot – 1 – chopped
  • Beans – 10 – chopped
  • Cauliflower Florets – 10
  • Mint Paste – 1 Tb sp ( blend – mint, coriander,green chillies, ginger piece, salt, lemon juice)
  • Curd – 1/2 cup
  • Turmeric Powder – 1/4 teaspoon
  • Biryani masala powder – 1 teaspoon
  • Red chilly powder – 1/2 teaspoon
  • Salt – 1 teaspoon
  • Butter – 2 Tb sp
  • Water – 320 ml

Procedure:

  • Heat a heavy bottomed deep fry pan, add butter, shajeera, cloves, cinnamon stick, Cardamom, bay leaf, and fry 30 secs.
  • Then add in chopped paneer cubes, saut√© half minute. Next add onion, Carrot, beans and saut√© 2 minutes
  • Now, add ginger garlic paste and mint paste saut√© one minute and add chopped cauliflower florets , rest of the paneer cubes and saut√© 2 more minutes
  • Then goes in, salt, Biryani Masala Powder, red chilly powder, turmeric powder and curd. Combine well and cook 5 minutes
  • Next add rice and gently mix with spatula then let it set for one minute on medium heat
  • Now add water and mix well
  • Cover with lid and Bring to a boil for 10 minutes and then reduce heat and let it cook for more 10 minutes.( don‚Äôt lift the lid in this process because if the vapor goes out and the rice won‚Äôt cook completely)
  • Next open lid and gently mix and check the rice, and turn off heat and let it sit more 5 minutes
  • Serve with Raita or cucumber salad or potato chips
  • Happy Cooking and Have a wonderful day

Step by step process shown below with pictures:

You will definitely like these rice recipes, please do check:

  • Bisi Bele Bath | Flavoured Lentils Rice | Karnataka Special Dish | Mom‚Äôs Recipe
  • Soya Chunks Vegetable Biryani | Lunch |Weekend Special
  • Radish Carrot Peas Pulav| Radish Rice | Lunch Recipe

Both accompanied very well and enriched the dish, I have also added Ajwain, cumin and sesame seeds to enhance the flavor in roti. This is one the easiest recipe...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
Breakfast recipe: Jonna rottellu

Servings: 6 roti‚Äôs

A fulfilling, healthy and delicious sorghum flour roti‚Äôs can made instantly with freshly chopped veggies and grated bottle Gourd. Both accompanied very well and enriched the dish, I have also added Ajwain, cumin and sesame seeds to enhance the flavor in roti. This is one the easiest recipe with wholesome goodness, homemade, gluten free, vegan and also you can checkout Jowar health benefits below. Try this nutritionist breakfast, I‚Äôm sure you like it

Health benefits of Jowar / sorghum flour:

  • Improves digestion
  • Boosts immunity
  • It is gluten free
  • Rich source of protein
  • Controls blood sugar level
  • High of fibre
  • Helps weight loss
  • Packed with essential Minerals and Vitamins
  • Good for Diabetics

Let‚Äôs start with Ingredients and follows Procedure

Duration: 30 minutes

Ingredients:

  • Jowar flour / sorghum flour – 240 grams
  • Hot Water ( Boiled) – 1/2 cup – 120 ml
  • Salt – 3/4 teaspoon
  • Green chillies – 4 – finely chopped
  • Ajwain / vaamu – 1/4 teaspoon
  • Cumin/ Jeera seeds – 1/2 teaspoon
  • Sesame seeds ( White ) – 1 teaspoon
  • Cilantro – 1/4 cup chopped
  • Carrot – grated – 1/4 cup
  • Bottled Gourd- Peeled off & grated – 1/2 cup
  • White onion – chopped – 1/3 cup
  • Coconut oil – To cook roti‚Äôs – 1 tb sp

Procedure:

  • In a wide bowl add flour, chopped & grated veggies , chillies, salt, cumin, Ajwain, sesame seeds
  • First, dry mix all ingredients and then add water then mix with a spoon or spatula because we are using hot water
  • Form a dough and divide it into 6 equal portions
  • Heat a tava on medium heat and make roti by applying oil on butter paper or on paper banana leaf
  • Tap the dough on sheet, make into round by dipping fingers in water( as shown in below pictures)
  • Add oil on tava and flip the sheet on it, let it sit for about half minute and gently remove sheet on tava, repeat the process to make other roti‚Äôs
  • Cook both sides by adding oil and till you see brown spots on it
  • It pairs with raw onion or pickle or curd and cucumber
  • Happy Cooking and Have a good day

Step by step process shown below with pictures:

You might also like these breakfast‚Äôs recipes:

  • Masala Dosa With Brown Rice |South Indian Savory Pan Cake
  • Kanchipuram Idly | South Indian Breakfast
  • Borugula Upma | Uggani |Puffed Rice Upma| Breakfast
  • Ragi Dosa| Finger Millet Dosa| Instant Ragi Dosa/ crepe | Breakfast
  • Idly Rava Upma | Quick Breakfast

Salad recipe: Channa salad Servings: 4 Fresh, healthy and protein packed salad! A delectable salad recipe to your tastebuds. It‚Äôs a best option at evening snack or as side in your breakfast or at lunch meal. A combination of freshly chopped veggies and beans tossed in salt , pepper and more. Easy to pack in...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
Salad recipe: Channa salad

Servings: 4

Fresh, healthy and protein packed salad! A delectable salad recipe to your tastebuds. It‚Äôs a best option at evening snack or as side in your breakfast or at lunch meal. A combination of freshly chopped veggies and beans tossed in salt , pepper and more.

Easy to pack in your kids lunch box and great way to indulge protein for everyone at home in a tasty way, it‚Äôs purely vegan recipe. I haven‚Äôt added cheese or curd for creamy consistency you can include if you wish for it. Try to use grated Parmesan cheese or paneer or tofu if you‚Äôre vegan . Do try my recipe, i hope you like the recipe and share your suggestions if you would like to knew more salad recipes. I do share

Duration: 12 hours ( soaking time ) + 30 minutes ( cooking time ) + 10 minutes ( preparation time)

Let‚Äôs start with Ingredients and follows Procedure

Ingredients:

  • Cooked Garbanzo Beans – 1 bowl ( if you wish, you can use canned chickpeas )
  • Cucumber – 1 – finely chopped
  • White onion – 1/4 cup – finely chopped
  • Red bell pepper – 1/4 cup – finely chopped
  • Carrot – 1/2 cup – grated
  • Coriander leaves – chopped
  • Lemon juice – 1 Tb sp
  • Salt – 1/2 teaspoon
  • Black Pepper Powder – 1/2 teaspoon
  • Dried basil – 1/4 teaspoon

Procedure:

  • Firstly, wash & Soak 160 grams of Garbanzo Beans/ channa in a wide bowl for 10-12 hours. Next add in pressure cooker with 1 teaspoon salt and cook them for 3 whistles. Turn off heat and strain water & keep aside
  • Take a mixing bowl, add in cooked beans, cucumber, carrots, onion, bell pepper, cilantro, salt, pepper powder, lemon juice and dried basil . Combine well and serve
  • You can add this salad in a taco or fill in roti or add in Mexican or Buddha bowl . It fulfills the meal and a best way to include protein in your diet.
  • Happy Cooking and Have a great day

Step by step process shown below with pictures:

These pancakes can made instantly, turned out yummy and delicious üòã I have added few different vegetables in pancake, you...
Read More
item.content:encoded:
Instant Breakfast: Vegetable Pancakes

Servings: 4 pancakes

Duration: 30 minutes ( cooking & preparation time )

Vegetable Pancakes are easy to make, today I have prepared new version of pancakes, it‚Äôs healthier, vegan and Eggless. These pancakes can made instantly, turned out yummy and delicious

I have added few different vegetables in pancake, you can include any combination of vegetables to make this pancake, such as cabbage, sweet potato, mushroom etc., Do try this healthy breakfast at home and enjoy your meal

Let‚Äôs start with Ingredients and follows Procedure

Ingredients:

  • Wheat Flour – 1/4 cup – 60 grams
  • Rice flour – 3/4 cup – 120 grams
  • Cumin seeds – 1 teaspoon
  • White sesame seeds – 1 teaspoon
  • Salt – 1/2 teaspoon
  • Green chillies – 2 – finely chopped
  • Carrot – peeled off – 1 small – julienne cut
  • Salad Cucumber – 1/2 – julienne cut
  • Red radish – 3 – julienne cut
  • White onion – 1 small – sliced thinly
  • Spring onion greens – chopped
  • Coconut oil – 5 teaspoons – to cook pancake both sides
  • Water – 120 ml

Procedure:

  • First chop all vegetables as per instructed
  • Next add vegetables, flours, cumin, sesame , salt and green chilles in a wide mixing bowl
  • Combine all ingredients , make sure flour coated well on the veggies
  • Then add 120 ml water and mix them again, you will get a thinly coated batter on veggies
  • Now heat up a pan on medium to high heat then smear oil with kitchen tissue on it
  • Next spread a ladle full of batter on pan and add 1/2 teaspoon oil and cook both sides till you find golden spots and also you can see the crispy texture
  • Now it’s time for plating, serve with yogurt or curd or pickle or chutney
  • Repeat the same process to prepare other pancakes.
  • Enjoy your day and happy cooking

Step by step process shown below with pictures:

Check out other breakfast recipes:

  • Rice Flour Roti With Bottle Gourd
  • Tapilintu / Akki roti / Rice flour roti
  • Palak Paratha/ Spinach Paratha || Indian Bread || Breakfast/ Dinner
